entry.def: A siding is a short railway track beside the main tracks, where engines and carriages are left when they are not being used.
Siding is a wooden or metal covering on the outside walls of a building.

means.word_mean: 1. a short stretch of railroad track used to store rolling stock or enable trains on the same line to pass
2. material applied to the outside of a building to make it weatherproof
